thread.title: Frost & Sullivan Hosts Flagship GIL Summit in Indonesia for the 4th Consecutive YearTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Frost & Sullivan Hosts Flagship GIL Summit in Indonesia for the 4th Consecutive YearTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Frost & Sullivan Hosts Flagship GIL Summit in Indonesia for the 4th Consecutive YearTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Frost & Sullivan Hosts Flagship GIL Summit in Indonesia for the 4th Consecutive Year Published on : Monday, October 5, 2015
Frost & Sullivan today hosted its flagship summit – Growth, Innovation & Leadership (GIL) Indonesia at the Shangri-La Hotel in Jakarta.Spike Choo, Country Director, Frost & Sullivan Indonesia said that it was a pleasure meeting and hosting Indonesia’s top business executives at GIL Indonesia this year.
“We are inspired and even more enthused about the unlimited potential that exists in our quest for excellence driven by all the monumental and innovative visionary perspectives. Such potential is being shared in more than 20 countries around the globe, by nearly 1 million business executives from 33 industries and 10 critical career functions for driving growth,” he added.
Spike Choo said that Frost & Sullivan’s GIL Global continues to be the only network of its kind supporting innovative, futuristic and visionary thinking to grow companies and careers.Frost & Sullivan’s team of analysts, Rudy Pranatia, Vita Andini and Daniel Wicaksana, shared their views on Mega Trends: Indonesia Perspective.
Frost & Sullivan’s key analysts in Asia Pacific also shared their latest research findings in the GIL Bytes Presentation, a rapid-fire session. Topics presented include:
Future of Government
Medical Tourism – Expanding Horizons
Meet the Smart Cities of the Future: Rethink Your Customer, Your Solutions & Your Strategy
Indonesia’s Logistics Growth Opportunities: Towards ASEAN Economic Community
Palm Oil & Downstream Outlook 2020
Internet of Things
Healthcare Policies in ASEAN: Impact & Opportunities
Connecting on Content: The Future of Marketing
Apart from Frost & Sullivan’s speakers, Setiaji, Head of Technical Implementation Unit, Jakarta Smart City, Department of Communications, Information and Public Relations, DKI Jakarta Province also delivered his presentation on Meet The Smart Cities of The Future: “Rethink Your Customer, Your Solutions and Your Strategy” along with Spike Choo as ICT Director, Frost & Sullivan Asia Pacific. In his presentation, Setiaji showed how he and his officials plan to bring Jakarta into a global metropolis using technology and social media.
Theodore Permadi Rachmat, Founder of Triputra Group also shared his experiences in the Legends of Indonesia panel. Romeo Fernandez Lledo, President Director of Siloam Hospitals, Ririek Ardiansyah, CEO of Telkomsel, Johari Zein, Founder & Director of TIKI JNE Jakarta, Endang Rachmawati, Country Director of Avaya Indonesia, and Anthonius Henricus, Developer Experience & Evangelism Director of Microsoft Indonesia also attended the congress as panelists on Convergence and Connected The World.Frost & Sullivan’s GIL in Asia Pacific will continue its journey with stops in Singapore on October 15th, 2015 and Sydney on December 3rd, 2015.
Source:-Frost & Sullivan
